description: Great for putting together a command line string to run it yourself, but it just plain crashes on launch in 19.04 when run as superuser. And two icons.. one for each the app and the app as superuser? Cmon there has to be a better way. Tried to research and fix this issue by reinstalling and re downloading as many dependencies as possible but at some point you have to abandon it for something that will work.
summary: Crashes due to QT conflict when run as SuperUser
Crashes trying to run as SU

description: Won't even launch. Can't restore the backup files to an upgraded system. Thank heavens I'm paranoid & keep multiple backup formats.
in a terminal type sudo luckybackup &
Absolutely useless! Crashes are the only thing that is reliable on this app as it crashes EVERY time I use it....

Juni 2020, auf Debian Buster installiert und nichts hat geholfen... Es kann sein dass irgendwas hilft, aber in Linux muss man ohnehin schon sehr viel manuell konfiguriert und angepasst werden, da sollte es solchen Programmen und vor allem wenn das Fehler schon ewig bekannt ist, endlich mal gefixt werden - Grsync basiert ebenfalls auf rsync und funktioniert reibungslos.
Das Programm lässt sich nicht starten ;-(

I use it for years. It is simple to create a job for User backup and also for copying/syncing USB and SD cards to/with HDD.
I use several external HDD for my computer backup. Not the best way but it works and is offline.
The restoring function also works for example for distribution update...
Hoy la baje creo un password en mi disco exterior que tuve formatear para recuperarlo... y la acabo de sacar..... la instale en Ubuntu 19.10
